Approved absence because of serious illness in the immediate
family can be charged to normal disability leave upon request
of the employee. Approved absence up to one-half day to attend
a funeral of a non-relative may be charged to disability leave.
Absence for Jury or Witness Service
Employees serving as jurors or witnesses shall receive regular
pay from the NAEB during the time of such service. However,
pay for such leaves will be computed as the difference between
the amount paid for the service and the regular full time salary
of the person on such leave.
Absence for Visit to Doctor or Dentist
All absences because of visits to doctors or dentists for rea¬
sons of personal health are charged to the employee’s disability
leave.
Extended Disability Leave
Permanent employees are entitled to an extended disability leave
of one work week with pay for each year of service, cumulative
to a total of ten work weeks, which shall be allowed to reac¬
cumulate to this maximum through additional service after being
used in full or in part. Extended disability leave is not to
be used until the normal disability leave has been used.
Revised February 1, 1962
